intro: Lebeckia brevipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lebeckia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in winter. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments. Lebeckia brevipes is well adapted to sandy soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
